Classes¶

Client¶

class grokpy.client.Aggregation¶

Enum-like class to specify valid aggregation strings

DAYS = 'DAYS'¶
HOURS = 'HOURS'¶
MINUTES = 'MINUTES'¶
MINUTES_15 = 'MINUTES_15'¶
MONTHS = 'MONTHS'¶
RECORD = 'RECORD'¶
SECONDS = 'SECONDS'¶
WEEKS = 'WEEKS'¶
class grokpy.client.Client(key=None, baseURL=None)¶

Top level object for interacting with the Grok Prediction Service.

Contains:

High Level Opertions Helper Methods

about()¶

Get current build and server information from API server

alignPredictions(headers, resultRows)¶

Puts prediction on the same row as the actual value for easy comparison in external tools like Excel.

Example Transformation:

RowID ActualValue PredictedValue 0 3 5 1 5 7 2 7 9

RowID ActualValue PredictedValue 0 3 1 5 5 2 7 7

9
createProject(projectName)¶

Creates a project through the Grok API

getProject(projectId)¶

Returns a Project with the given id

getPublicDataSource(id)¶

Looks up and returns a PDS by its code.

listProjects()¶

Lists all the projects currently associated with this account

listPublicDataSources()¶

Lists all the public data sources registered with Grok

testConnection()¶

Makes a minimial service call to test the API connection

class grokpy.client.DataFlag¶

Enum-like class to specify valid data flag strings

NONE = 'NONE'¶
RESET = 'RESET'¶
SEQUENCE = 'SEQUENCE'¶
TIMESTAMP = 'TIMESTAMP'¶
class grokpy.client.GrokData¶

Enum-like class to specify valid Grok data type strings

DATETIME = 'DATETIME'¶
ENUMERATION = 'ENUMERATION'¶
IP_ADDRESS = 'IP_ADDRESS'¶
LAT_LONG = 'LAT_LONG'¶
SCALAR = 'SCALAR'¶
ZIP_CODE = 'ZIP_CODE'¶
class grokpy.client.Status¶

Enum-like class to specify valid Swarm status strings

CANCELED = 'CANCELED'¶
COMPLETED = 'COMPLETED'¶
RUNNING = 'RUNNING'¶

Connection¶

class grokpy.connection.Connection(key=None, baseURL='http://grok-api.numenta.com')¶

Connection object for the Grok Prediction Service

request(requestDef, method='POST', body=False, headers=None)¶

Interface for all HTTP requests made to the Grok API

Exceptions¶

Base exceptions for the Grok Client Library

Field¶

class grokpy.field.Field(**kwargs)¶

A complex object specification which allows Grok to properly interpret input data.

Model¶

class grokpy.model.Model(parentProject, modelDef={})¶

Object representing a Grok Model

delete()¶

Permanently deletes the model

disableLearning()¶

Puts the model into a predictions only state where it will not learn from new data.

enableLearning()¶

New records will be integrated into the models future predictions.

getDescription()¶

Get the current state of the model from Grok

getPredictions(startRow=-1, endRow=-1)¶

Retrieves all the predictions from the models output from startRow to endRow.

Defaults to getting all predictions. Warning: This could be up to 50k rows.

getSwarmProgress()¶

Polls the server for progress of a running Swarm

getSwarmResults(startRow=-1, endRow=-1)¶

Returns the data in the output cache of the best model found during a Grok Swarm

The default start/end row values request all the data available.

monitorPredictions(endRow=False)¶

Continually polls for new predictions until endRow is hit.

TODO: Move from polling to async streaming when API server supports

monitorSwarm(swarmMonitor, async=False)¶

swarmMonitor - An instance of the grokpy.streaming.StreamMonitor class. async - Toggle to run this as a separate thread

swarmMonitor methods should return False to exit the loop.

monitorSwarmProgress(newStateCallback)¶

Listens to a stream of output from the API server

promote()¶

Promotes the model to production ready status. This transitions a model that has gone through a Swarm to a model ready to accept new streaming records.

NOTE: This may have ongoing charges if you don’t call stop on the model when not in use.

sendRecords(data)¶

Sends data directly to a model rather than having the model listen to a stream. Only available on promoted models. TODO: Remove this method, as it is incompatible with new object model

Data: A list of lists representing rows of data

setLocationField(fieldName)¶

Wrapper for setLocationFieldIndex()

setName(newName)¶

Rename the model

setNote(newNote)¶

Adds or updates a note for this model

setPredictionField(fieldName)¶

Wrapper for setPredictionFieldIndex()

setPredictionFieldIndex(index)¶

The stream field for which we are optimizing predictions.

setStream(stream)¶

Associates a stream with a model

setTemporalField(fieldName)¶

Wrapper for setTemporalFieldIndex()

setTemporalFieldIndex(index)¶

Which stream field provides temporal data for the model

setTimeAggregation(aggregationType)¶

How the model will aggregate data within the stream

Valid Types:

RECORD: no aggregation is done. SECONDS MINUTES 15_MINUTES HOURS DAYS WEEKS MONTHS

start()¶

Starts up a model, readying it to receive new data from a stream

startSwarm()¶

Runs permutations on model parameters to find the optimal model characteristics for the given data.

stop()¶

Stops a model. Stopped models will not listen for new data or produce predictions

stopSwarm()¶

Terminates a Swarm in progress

Project¶

class grokpy.project.Project(connection, projectDef)¶

Object representing a Grok project

createJoinFile(dataFilePath, specFilePath)¶

Uploads the contents of a csv file which can be used to programatically add fields to records in a stream.

createModel()¶

Create a model associated with this project

createStream()¶

Returns an instance of the Stream object

delete()¶

Permanently deletes this project, its models and streams TODO: Verify with new OM

getDescription()¶

Get the current state of the project from Grok

getModel(modelId)¶

Returns the model corresponding to the given modelId

listModels()¶

Returns a list of Models that exist in this project

setName(newName)¶

Rename the project

stopAllModels()¶

A convenience method to stop all models that have been promoted

Public Data Source¶

class grokpy.publicDataSource.PublicDataSource(connection, description)¶

Object describing a public data source

Currently this lives only in the client. The intent is to have a server side object representing a PDS as well.

listFields()¶

Returns a list of the names of fields currently in the PDS

setConfiguration(value=None, locationFieldName=None)¶

Populates the ‘configuration’ field within the provider. What this configuration should be varies from provider to provider.

See the API Reference under providerDefinitionList

useField(fieldName)¶

Sets a field to be added to the data stream by this publicDataSource for every record passed into Grok

Stream¶

class grokpy.stream.Stream(parentProject)¶

A Stream is the combination of data and the specification of those data that will be used by a model

addField(**kwargs)¶

Add a field object to a stream

addRecords(records)¶

Appends records to the input cache of the given stream.

WARNING: HACK

Due to the current object model we actually send the records in the model.startSwarm() method.

configure(filePath)¶

Reads JSON from a given file and uses that to configure the stream

useJoinFile(joinFile)¶

Binds a Join File to the stream and tells it how to process incoming records using the file.

joinFile - A JoinFile Object

usePublicDataSource(publicDataSource)¶

Takes a configured publicDataSource and attaches it to the stream

Stream Monitor¶

class grokpy.streaming.StreamMonitor¶
on_error(status_code)¶

Called when a non-200 status code is returned

on_state(state)¶

Called when a new state is received from connection.

Override this method if you wish to manually handle the stream data. Return False to stop stream and close connection.

on_timeout()¶

Called when stream connection times out
